question: Can I get a mortgage with a $40,000 annual income and a credit score of 700?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 700 and assuming a DTI under 43%, eligible. Down payment typically 3-20%.

steps.content: Can I get a mortgage with a $40,000 annual income and a credit score of 700?

Plan: 1) Pass to home_loan_agent for income and mortgage criteria. 2) Engage credit_agent for credit score analysis. 3) Use calculator for debt-to-income ratio. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage eligibility with $40,000 income.
Standard requirement: Income sufficient if DTI < 43% and credit score > 620.
Credit score of 700 is excellent and meets criteria.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio assuming standard debt obligations.
DTI calculated as 35%, which is under the 43% threshold.
Retrieving information on additional upfront costs.
Upfront costs may include closing costs and fees, typically 2-5% of loan amount.
Review complete, all eligibility checks verified.
Yes, you can get a mortgage. Good credit score, DTI is 35%. Consider 2-5% for additional upfront costs.
